children.type: (value: Y, index: number, array: Y[]) => ReactNode
children.description: The render function to render each item in the array.

fallback.description: The fallback content to render when the array is empty.

filter.type: (value: Y, index: number, array: Y[]) => boolean
filter.description: A function that returns a boolean indicating whether the item should be included in the render result.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to include in the render result.

offset.description: The number of items to skip before including them in the render result.

reverse.description:
The boolean value to determine the order of the items in the array.
If `true`, the items will be reversed.
If `sortBy` is provided, inversion is applied to the sorted array.

sort.description:
The function to sort the items in the array.
If function is provided, the items will be sorted based on the return value.
If `reverse` is `true`, the inversion is applied to the sorted array.
